I join our community in mourning the sudden death of SeaTac City Councilmember Amina Ahmed. She was an incredible advocate for immigrants & refugees and worked hard to make our community better for everyone. My thoughts and prayers are with her family during this difficult time.

This continued expansion of the use of Department of Defense resources and personnel to fulfill the misguided immigration agenda of this administration, which is not part of the mission of the DOD, must come to an end. 6/6

Full statement ➡️ https://bit.ly/2QDpFkt

Directing military servicemembers to ‘harden the border’ and provide vague support to Customs and Border Protection misses the point entirely. These people are fleeing violence and persecution to seek asylum. They are turning themselves in, not circumventing our laws. 5/6

The continued practice of detaining asylum seekers is inhumane. It’s abhorrent that there are over 40,000 people in custody in detention centers across the US when we know alternatives to detention are proven to be effective and drastically less costly. 4/6

There's no question that we face a challenge with a rise in the number of people seeking asylum. However, the response should not be deploying troops to our border, but instead increasing resources to process asylum applications, including additional judges & asylum officers. 3/6
The President’s dangerous rhetoric referring to people seeking asylum as an ‘invasion’ deeply misrepresents the situation and needlessly ramps up tension. 2/6

I continue to strongly question the deployment of U.S. military servicemembers at our southern border. The decision to extend this deployment to the end of January 2019 is not a responsible use of DOD resources and is the completely wrong approach to the situation. 1/6 pic.twitter.com/l8J9cRHXNw
